tips.title: Teaching Tips
tips.description: Find teaching advice for various driving topics to help your students learn effectively.

basicHandling.title: Basic Vehicle Handling
basicHandling.overview: Mastering fundamental control of the vehicle is the foundation of all safe driving.
basicHandling.tip1: Start in safe, open areas like an empty parking lot.
basicHandling.tip2: Ensure understanding of basic controls (clutch, accelerator, brakes) before moving.
basicHandling.tip3: Emphasize smooth, controlled movements (steering, acceleration, braking).
basicHandling.tip4: Practice basic maneuvers repeatedly until comfortable.
basicHandling.tip5: Provide clear, step-by-step instructions for maneuvers like reversing and hill starts.

trafficSituations.title: Traffic Situations
trafficSituations.overview: Navigating traffic situations safely is crucial for responsible driving.
trafficSituations.tip1: Emphasize constant observation and anticipation (scanning, mirror checks, blind spots).
trafficSituations.tip2: Teach proper procedures for intersections, roundabouts, and traffic lights.
trafficSituations.tip3: Practice lane changes in various traffic densities.
trafficSituations.tip4: Focus on maintaining safe following distances in all situations.

highwayDriving.title: Highway Driving
highwayDriving.overview: Highway driving requires specific skills and awareness.
highwayDriving.tip1: Teach proactive awareness: constant scanning (mirrors, blind spots), anticipating flow.
highwayDriving.tip2: Practice merging and exiting at appropriate speeds.
highwayDriving.tip3: Reinforce proper lane discipline (stay right unless overtaking).

parking.title: Parking
parking.overview: Parking requires precision and spatial awareness.
parking.tip1: Break down each parking type (parallel, bay, angled) into clear, sequential steps.
parking.tip2: Use reference points for guidance (aligning mirrors, specific points on the car/space).
parking.tip3: Emphasize slow, controlled speed during maneuvers.
parking.tip4: Stress the importance of all-around checks (mirrors, blind spots, physically looking).

specialConditions.title: Special Conditions
specialConditions.overview: Special conditions require adapting driving techniques.
specialConditions.tip1: Teach proper use of lights (headlights, high beams, fog lights).
specialConditions.tip2: Explain reduced visibility challenges and how to compensate (slower speed, increased distance).
specialConditions.tip3: Discuss hydroplaning (rain) and loss of traction (ice/snow) risks.
specialConditions.tip4: Emphasize gentle inputs in slippery conditions.

riskManagement.title: Risk Management
riskManagement.overview: Identifying and managing risks is the cornerstone of safe driving.
riskManagement.tip1: Teach systematic hazard identification (scanning patterns, common risk areas).
riskManagement.tip3: Promote defensive driving principles (anticipation, space management).
riskManagement.tip4: Practice emergency braking techniques in a safe environment.
